Recap: At Dinah and Mallet's engagement party, Dinah shows Harley her website where she has made the wedding plans. But, as she loads the site, the Springfield Burns website comes up. On it there is a surveillance report all about Dinah's past criminal history. She is humiliated and asks Mallet why this is on the site. He evades the question and she runs away. Later, he tells her that the FBI was going to send her to jail if he didn't keep tabs on her. She realizes that he has been doing this throughout their entire relationship. She is devastated and tells him that he has ruined everything. Josh stays over at Cassie's house and sleeps on the couch after RJ asks him to stay. Olivia plans to get Ava a job to get back in Frank and Buzz's good graces, but she has arranged a job just above housekeeping. Blake goes to Jeffrey's room after he gives her his room keys.
Transcript: Dinah: Come on, my sweet little rabbit, let's go. Come on. Snap it up. Finish getting dressed, please. We're going to be late for our engagement party. What are you looking at?
Mallet: Nothing. I'm just, you know, baseball and stuff.
Dinah: "Springfield Burns", again. Good.
Mallet: Yeah, I'm just checking it out to see if they posted any new trash on this web site, but I don't know, it says it's under construction.
Dinah: It is under construction, which means finally somebody shut it down. Thank goodness.
Mallet: Well, maybe. Maybe.
Dinah: Not maybe. Listen, this confirms that Alan-Michael was behind the whole thing. He gets a top seat at Spaulding and he stops harassing me. Very clear.
Mallet: I don't know. I don't know.
Dinah: No. A.C., listen to me, baby. I do know. The one thing-- we are no longer blog fodder, okay?
Mallet: (Laughs)
Dinah: We have one thing to focus on, and that's getting married. All right? Maybe one other thing we need to focus on.
Mallet: Mmm.
Dinah: Mmm.
Mallet: Not the blog?
Dinah: Not the blog. Maybe a little lovin'.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Harley: So, hey, you going to plant a big, fat, wet kiss on the bride-to-be tonight?
Gus: Oh, God, can you let it go? Babe, I was high as a kite. She was just trying to help.
Harley: With her tongue?
Gus: I was appreciating it.
Harley: Mm-hmm. I'll act like I'm letting it go, okay? Hi, Daddy.
Buzz: Hey, kiddo. Hey, kiddo.
Harley: Okay.
Buzz: Okay, what?
Harley: Are you surprised?

Buzz: Am I... oh! You mean that you dumped your big, fat Spaulding paycheck to go back on the force? No, I'm not surprised. Police work's always been your first love. Second love, that's me and the kids.
Harley: And guess what? I'm going to talk Frank into partnering me with Gus again.
Gus: Mallet would have to find another partner. Frank's not going to go for that.

Harley: Nobody cares what Frank thinks, anyway. But then he and I are going to be a team both on and off the force, and I'll have my eye on him every single second. Won't that be great? (Mild laughter)
Gus: Hi, Buzz.
Ava: Hey, Buzz? Can you help me with the hors d'oeuvres I just made you?
Buzz: Oh, I love it when you talk French.
Ava: (Laughs)
[SCENE_BREAK]
Josh: So R.J., you and I will wrap the present for Dinah and Mallet, while your mom goes upstairs and changes.
Cassie: I don't think so. I'm not going to the party. I'm not even in a partying mood. My daughter's in the hospital.

Josh: Your daughter is the one that said you should get out of the house and have a good time. So, R.J. and I will stay here and hold down the fort. It's okay, Cassie, really, I... I have it under control.
Cassie: I know you do.
R.J.: Mom, go. Don't be so stubborn or else I'll have to start tickling you.
Cassie: No, you better not tickle me! No, R.J.!
Josh: Go get her, R.J.!
Cassie: I don't like to be tickled! (Laughs) Don't!
Josh: Hey, don't get me.
Cassie: Okay, okay! I'll go!

Vanessa: Hey, Blake. What's wrong? It's wonderful about those poll numbers. You should be putting the champagne on ice.
Blake: I know. Yeah, well, the voters they love me and they feel for me.
Vanessa: What's wrong with that?

Blake: It's a sympathy vote. The kindly, little widow that they feel sorry for. Nobody takes me seriously, though. Really, why should they? It's not like I have a law degree or I'm all that responsible or, you know, even attractive. The latest poll said they like me, but they don't like... my clothes. What is that, really? I'm sorry, I really... I just can't talk to you about this. I just... I don't... I don't have anybody to talk to. Dinah, even Dinah is... she doesn't want me in her wedding party. How low can a person get?

Harley: Whoa!
Mallet: Yay! There they are! (Cheering and whistling)
Harley: There they are, the bride and groom.
Dinah: Thank you.
Gus: Can I get you a stiff drink there, Dinah?
Dinah: White wine, thank you.
Harley: My father made all your favorite stuff. Pigs in a blanket. Come see all the good food.
Dinah: Ah, thank you.
Mallet: Not the cheese balls? Does he have cheese balls?
Harley: I want to go back on the force.
Mallet: That's what Dinah was telling me, I think it's a good idea. You should go for it.
Harley: Even if it means you partner with somebody else? Because I want to work with Gus.
Mallet: Really, you do? Well, I don't... okay, I don't see a problem with that.
Harley: Well, do you have a problem talking to Frank, then, and tell him that you don't care? Because if he thinks you don't care, he won't care either.
Mallet: Right, talk to Frank?
Harley: Please?
Mallet: That's an interesting question...
Gus: Hi, honey. What are you guys talking shop? Leave the guy alone. It's his... it's his time. Cheeseball, it's your favorite. Come on, feel right at home.
Olivia: Hey. Whoop, I'm good.
Buzz: You're good.
Olivia: This is a party, let's liven this place up. Whoo! (Turns on music) That's better!

Cassie: Okay, so...
Josh: Hey!
Cassie: ...As to R.J's bedtime...
Josh: Ha! I know, I know, I know, I know. 8:30, in bed with a book. 9:00, lights out. Go. Have a great time, okay?
R.J.: That's an order.
Cassie: All right, all right. I'm stopping by the hospital to see Tammy on the way there and on the way back, so I may be late.

R.J.: Go!
Josh: Go.
Cassie: Thank you.
Josh: Bye.
Cassie: Bye.

R.J.: Okay.

R.J.: Mm-hmm.

Josh: Lot of wrapping, but I think we did it well.
R.J.: Yep.
Josh: Cheers.

Vanessa: Still making people happy wherever you go, I see?
Olivia: Hello, Vanessa.

Olivia: Well, you'll be pleased to know that I am officially single.
Vanessa: Oh, well I'm sure you'll find another life to ruin.
Olivia: Maybe I will. Where is that handsome boy toy of yours?
Vanessa: He's right over there. Why don't u go ahead and take your best shot?
Olivia: Is it bad engagement party etiquette to slap the mother of the bride? I want to know.
Ava: Okay, excuse me. Okay... pardon me. We're going to go outside for a second.
Olivia: Get your soily hands off of me.
Ava: What are you trying to do? Stop it. Are you trying to ruin this party? You're trashed.

Jeffrey: Did you lose my number?

Olivia: It's not easy for me to be here.

Olivia: I know. I know you know, and I know you know me and Cooper's so well. Which is why... I need you.

Cassie: Are you really talking about the me and Josh thing? Because that's getting old.

Cassie: Look, I needed to cancel the weekend because I didn't think it was a good idea.

Jeffrey: You know what? It's a party. Let's enjoy ourselves, huh? It's too bad about the weekend, we could have had fun.

Kim Zimmer, "Inside The Light." Reva gets to drive the Tide car. I got to ride around with Travis Kvapell who is the Tide driver and just a sexy, charming, charismatic young man. See Reva, Wednesday, July 26, "Inside The Light."

Mallet: Dinah. Dinah. Dinah.

Cassie: That is exactly what I'm going to do. Would you please keep your voice down?
Blake: Well, all I'm saying is that you should...
Cassie: Oh, I know what you're saying, and please don't say it.

Cassie: Shhh!

Cassie: Will you be quiet? What has come into you?
Blake: You know, I don't know, I'm just ticked off.

Blake: I'm just... I'm lonely. And... so are you, right? Life's short, Cassie, you know? Really, it would be so nice if one of us scored tonight.
Cassie: Wow. Well, it is not going to be me.
Blake: Never say never.

Olivia: I wonder what that was about.
Ava: I'm sure we're going to find out. What is this with you suddenly needing me for something?

Olivia: You know how I feel about Frank and Buzz. I care about them both so much.
Ava: Which is the problem.
Olivia: I made a mistake. It was a mistake. I never intended to hurt either one of them. And now they won't talk to me. I miss them, Ava. I just want to be friends.
Ava: That's a good word for it.

Olivia: Yeah, well they're not going to be anything else to me now, are they? Okay? So, yes, I want to be friends. They're two of the most amazing people I've ever known. And for whatever reason, they think you walk on water. So at the risk of sounding shallow and self-serving...
Ava: Sounds good.
Olivia: ...I figure the best way to get into their good graces is to first get back into yours.
Ava: Back?
Olivia: Well, when you were my assistant a while back, we made a pretty good team.
Ava: Until you fired me out of spite.

Olivia: Come on, Ava, you're ambitious. You're ambitious. You don't want to be a waitress the rest of your life, do you? We worked well together. You know, you're good with people and you're somewhat presentable and kind of organized.
Ava: Okay, excuse me. Are you offering me a job?
[SCENE_BREAK]
Mallet: Dinah.
Dinah: Nothing you can say can make me any less furious at you.

Mallet: Oh, baby. Oh, man. Do you think... do you think I wanted to file all those reports on you? Do you think I liked filing those reports on you and keeping it from you? Baby, I didn't have a choice.
Dinah: Okay, well you're making it sound like Frank had a gun at your head and make you do it.
Mallet: It wasn't for Frank. It was the FBI.
Dinah: (Laughs) The FBI?! The FBI? Since when did they care about me?
Mallet: Ever since you tried to shoot Edmund and toss him off of a cliff. Actually, they've been interested in you since you shot Hart, fled the country and bartered your way out of a foreign prison.
Dinah: So how long, huh? How long have you been making reports on me and how long have you been watching me? Huh? Ever since we were... together? Before we were together?
Mallet: Dinah, I didn't have a choice. I didn't have a choice.
Dinah: The whole time? The whole time we were together?
Mallet: Dinah, listen to me.
Mallet: Please just hear me out, okay? Do you know why I filed those reports on you, Dinah? Do you know why? Because if I hadn't, you'd be in prison right now.
Dinah: That's bull.
Mallet: No, that's the truth. Do you know why the feds never pressed charges after your run- in with Edmund? Do you know why? Because I stepped in for you.
Dinah: You barely even knew me then.
Mallet: You're right, I didn't. But I knew you well enough to know I couldn't... couldn't bare to watch them send you away. I thought, "Maybe this girl just needs a chance."
Dinah: What was I, a charity case to you? Is that what our relationship was? Like you... you just felt sorry for me?

Mallet: Stop. Just let me finish, okay? Please, just let me finish. Just hear me out. (Sighs) I saw something in you then. I used every contact I had at the Bureau to try to get someone to listen to me, that this woman does not belong in prison. And I told them, "I will vouch for her." And you know what? They agreed. Under one condition: That I file reports on you-- on you and your activities. It's not the deal that I wanted, obviously, but I thought, you know, that's a small price to pay to keep you out of prison. Baby, come on, was I wrong on that?
Dinah: I can't believe I'm hearing this.
Mallet: I did it because I thought I was helping you. I did it because I thought I was protecting you.
Dinah: Why didn't you tell me?
Mallet: I couldn't. The Feds.
Dinah: I am your allegiance. Comes me, me first.
Mallet: I swore to them as a law enforcement officer.
Dinah: I don't care. I don't care. Those reports that you made, made me sound like a common criminal.
Mallet: Baby, it's not like that.
Dinah: What else haven't you told me?
Mallet: Nothing. Nothing. I'm sorry. I hurt you, I'm sorry. Maybe there's just all kinds of other things going on right now. Maybe that's why... maybe it's just hitting you so hard because of that.
Dinah: Such as?

Mallet: I don't know. All the wedding, all the stress. You know, maybe we're both just freaking out. Remember the other day when you were doubting us? You know, and doubting yourself? I don't know, maybe... maybe you're just doing it now.
Dinah: Are you serious? Are you serious? (Sobbing) I think I might even just hit you again right now because you were sounding so unbelievably condescending.
Mallet: That's not... that's not what I'm talking about.

Dinah: Yeah, it is. It is. You know why? Because you're making it sound like I am the silly little crazy Dinah that's going to go into a tizzy over nothing. But it is not nothing, okay? You kept tabs on me, and I know exactly how you think. That is exactly why you did not tell me about this deal that you struck, because you knew how much it was going to hurt me.
Mallet: Yeah, I knew that.

Dinah: Yeah, you knew that. But you know what? You don't know that. You don't know that. You don't have a clue how I feel inside. You don't. Because you know what? You have always wanted me to be something else! You have always wanted me to be someone else, and I don't know, let's guess! Who have you wanted me to be!
Mallet: That's not true and you know that. We're way past that.
Dinah: Oh, are we?
Mallet: Yes. I love you because of you. You know that.

Dinah: Oh, yeah, yeah. Do you know what? You don't trust me. You don't trust me. You don't trust me to do things the right way. You think I'm going to just go on this spontaneous rampage and be like the old Dinah. The old Dinah that's going to mess things up. But you know why? Because you've never wanted me. You never wanted someone like me. You want someone organized and together who's going to come to you in a white wedding dress. Well, that's not going to be me. That is never going to be me!
Mallet: Stop, you're twisting things around.
Dinah: You see, I trusted you. And I thought you trusted me. My God, Mallet, I needed you to trust me. But this whole thing has just been a lie from the beginning. It's just been a lie.
